intro: Cirsium flavispina, commonly known as the yellow-spined thistle, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–80 cm, featuring spiny leaves with a distinctive yellowish spine at the base. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color, blooming in late summer to early autumn. Cirsium flavispina is often found in rocky or dry habitats, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
